bgameb package

bgameb.base module

Base constructs for build package objects

bgameb.base.log_enable(log_path: str = './logs/game.log', log_level: str = 'DEBUG') → None[source]

Enable logging

Parameters

  • log_path (str, optional) – path to log file. Defaults to ‘./logs/game.log’.

  • log_level (str, optional) – logging level. Defaults to ‘DEBUG’.

Bases: Component

Base class for game, stuff, tools players and other components

Attr:

  • id (str): id of component

  • counter (Counter): counter object

  • _type (Optional[str]): type for check when this component can be added

  • _types_to_add (List[str]): types of components, that can be added

Counter is a ‘collection.Counter <https://docs.python.org/3/library/collections.html#collections.Counter>’ object

Args must be a dicts

id: str
counter: Counter
add(component) → None[source]

Add another component to this component

Parameters

component (Component) – component instance

class bgameb.items.Dice(id: str, counter: ~collections.Counter = <factory>, _type: ~typing.Optional[str] = None, _types_to_add: ~typing.List[str] = <factory>, count: int = 1, sides: int = 2)[source]

Bases: BaseItem

Rolled or fliped objects, like dices or coins.

Sides attr define number of sides of roller. Default to 2. Sides can’t be less than 2.

Example:
    dice = Dice('coin', sides=2)
Raises

StuffDefineError – number of sides less than 2

Args must be a dicts

sides: int = 2
roll() → List[int][source]

Roll and return result

Returns

result of roll

Return type

List[int]

class bgameb.items.Card(id: str, counter: ~collections.Counter = <factory>, _type: ~typing.Optional[str] = None, _types_to_add: ~typing.List[str] = <factory>, count: int = 1, opened: bool = False, tapped: bool = False, side: ~typing.Optional[str] = None)[source]

Bases: BaseItem

Card object

Attr:

  • opened (bool): is card oppened. Default to False.

  • tapped (bool): is card tapped. Default to False.

  • side (str, optional): the side of tap. Default to None.

Example:
    card = CardType('unique_card')
    card.tap(side='left')

Args must be a dicts

opened: bool = False
tapped: bool = False
side: Optional[str] = None
flip() → None[source]

Face up or face down the card regardles of it condition

open() → None[source]

Face up the card

hide() → None[source]

Face down the card

tap(side='right') → None[source]

Tap the card to the given side

Parameters

side (str, optional) – side to tap. Defaults to ‘right’.

untap() → None[source]

Untap the card

alter() → None[source]

Many cards have alter views. For example card can have main view, that apply most time of the game and second view, that apply only if card played as that alternative. For ease of understanding, consider that different views of the same card are not related directly to each other.

class bgameb.tools.Deck(id: str, counter: ~collections.Counter = <factory>, _type: ~typing.Optional[str] = None, _types_to_add: ~typing.List[str] = <factory>, current: ~typing.Deque[~bgameb.items.Card] = <factory>)[source]

Bases: BaseTool

Deck object

Deck ia a Bag subclass that contains Cards for define curent game deque.

You can add cards, define it counts and deal a deck. Result is saved in current deck attr as deque object. This object has all methods of python deque

Example:
    deque(Card1, Card3, Card2, Card4)

Args must be a dicts

current: Deque[Card]
deal() → Deque[Card][source]

Deal new random shuffled deck and save it to self.current

shuffle() → Deque[Card][source]

Random shuffle current deck

to_arrange(start: int, end: int) → Tuple[List[Card], Tuple[List[Card], List[Card]]][source]

Prepare current deck to arrange

Parameters

  • start (int) – start of slice

  • end (int) – end of slice

Start and end cant be less than 0 and end must be greater than start. Arranged deck are splited to two part - center (used for arrange part of deck) and tupple with last part of deck. You can rearrange center part and then concatenate it with last part in new deque by arrange() method.

Returns

part to arrange

Return type

Tuple[List[Card], Tuple[List[Card]]

arrange(arranged: List[Card], last: Tuple[List[Card], List[Card]]) → Deque[Card][source]

Concatenate new current deck from given arranged list and last of deck. Use to_arrange() method to get list to arrange and last.

Parameters

  • arranged (List[Card]) – arranged list of cards

  • last – (Tuple[List[Card], List[Card]]): last of deck

search(query: Dict[str, int], remove: bool = True) → List[Card][source]

Search for cards in current deck

Parameters

  • query (Dict[str, int]) – dict with id of searched cards and count of searching

  • remove (bool) – if True - remove searched cards from current deck. Default to True.

Returns

list of find cards

Return type

List[Card]

Example:
    game.deck1.search(
        {'card1': 2,
         'card2': 1 },
        remove=False
        )
get_random(count: int = 1, remove: bool = True) → List[Card][source]

Get random cards from current deck

Parameters

  • count (int, optional) – count of random cards. Defaults to 1.

  • remove (bool, optional) – if True - remove random cards from current deck. Default to True.

Returns

list of random cards

Return type

List[Card]

Bases: object

Order of steps priority queue. Isnt tradesafe. Is used only for define game steps order.

Attr:

  • current List[Tuple[int, Component]]: priority queue list

current: List[Tuple[int, Step]]

Parameters

get() → Step[source]

Get Sеep object from queue with lowest priority

Step instance object

Return type

Base class for other runtime exceptions

Bases: CustomRuntimeError

Bases: CustomRuntimeError

Given class isn’t component.
